results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 6.
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Jeremy Swan and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: In “Triple treat”, confusion reigns supreme when Conrad and Otto make two replica’s of Penelope’s magic opal. There’s lots of opal rubbing but little magic as a result! Bruce finally gets the opal back to the cave in “It’s still magic” and is about to free himself when Penelope and Baz accuse him of selfishness. Eventually some sort of compromise is reached and Bruce finds out about the magic of romance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Jeremy Swan and Esben Storm

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 5.
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Jeremy Swan and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: In a ‘Tale of two cities’, Conrad works out that Bruce and Baz are genies and tries to learn more about their secret powers. In ‘School daze’ Penelope wishes herself back in England to avoid having to go to school in Australia and finds that she has to sit a “catch up” exam at her school when she returns.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Jeremy Swan and Esben Storm

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 4.
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Brendan Maher and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: Another two exciting episodes in this excellent series for children. In ‘Nobody’s perfect’, in an effort to stop Bruce from misinterpreting her wishes, Penelope writes down her perfect wish. In ‘Triple agent’, Conrad is convinced that Bruce may be a vampire or cyborg and tries to catch him out.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Brendan Maher and Esben Storm

results.brief_description: From the producers of “Round the twist” and “Skytrackers”, two more episodes in the adventures of Penelope Townes and the two genies she found in an opal - Bruce and his son Baz - “Larceny”’ and “The Eternal quadrangle.”

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar and Phil Jones
results.brief_description: From the producers of “Round the twist” and “Skytrackers” comes a series about a young girl, Penelope Townes who finds a magic opal which contains two genies, Bruce and his son Baz. She thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have everything she wants. Bruce, however has other ideas. The first three episodes of this series are: “Wishing and hoping”, “It’s my opal…and I’ll cry if I want to” and Where it’s at.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar and Phil Jones

results.title: The Genie from down under: wishing and hoping
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: When upper class English girl Penelope Townes finds a magic opal which contains two Australian genies, Bruce and his son Baz, she thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have anything she wants. Bruce, however, has other ideas.
results.title_for_label: The Genie from down under: wishing and hoping
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Esben Storm

results.title: The Genie from down under: where it's at
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: Bruce wants to become human but to do this he must take the opal to the cave where it was mined over a hundred years before. He sets out to trick Penelope into visiting the cave.
results.title_for_label: The Genie from down under: where it’s at

results.title: The Genie from down under: larceny
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Brendan Maher
results.brief_description: Bruce helps Otto and Conrad get the opal because he thinks they will help him return to Australia. Instead, the von Meisters sell it for 25,000 pounds. It’s now up to the genies to sort the mess out.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Brendan Maher

results.title: The Genie from down under: it's my opal and I'll cry if I want to
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ABC-TV (Australia), British Broadcasting Corporation, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Jeremy Swan
results.brief_description: Tour operator, Otto von Meister, and his nephew, Conrad, arrive at Townes Downs with a load of tourists. When he learns about the opal Otto recalls that it belonged to their family years before and he and Conrad are desperate to get it back.
results.title_for_label: The Genie from down under: it’s my opal and I’ll cry if I want to
